segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 25. Āpattibhayavagga
segments.en: 25. Perils of Offenses

segments.pli: 243. Saṅghabhedakasutta
segments.en: 243. Schism in the Saṅgha

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “api nu taṃ, ānanda, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantan”ti?
segments.en: “Well, Ānanda, has that disciplinary issue been settled yet?”

segments.pli: “Kuto taṃ, bhante, adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamissati.
segments.en: “How could it be, sir?

segments.pli: Āyasmato, bhante, anuruddhassa bāhiyo nāma saddhivihāriko kevalakappaṃ saṃghabhedāya ṭhito.
segments.en: Venerable Anuruddha’s pupil Bāhiya remains entirely committed to creating a schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Tatrāyasmā anuruddho na ekavācikampi bhaṇitabbaṃ maññatī”ti.
segments.en: But Anuruddha doesn’t think to say a single word about it.”

segments.pli: “Kadā panānanda, anuruddho saṃghamajjhe adhikaraṇesu voyuñjati.
segments.en: “But Ānanda, since when has Anuruddha been involved in disciplinary issues in the midst of the Saṅgha?

segments.pli: Nanu, ānanda, yāni kānici adhikaraṇāni uppajjanti, sabbāni tāni tumhe ceva vūpasametha sāriputtamoggallānā ca.
segments.en: Shouldn’t you, together with Sāriputta and Moggallāna, settle all disciplinary issues that come up?

segments.pli: Cattārome, ānanda, atthavase sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṅghabhedena nandati.
segments.en: A bad monk sees four reasons to relish schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idhānanda, pāpabhikkhu dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakammanto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
segments.en: Take an unethical monk, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, underhand, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: He thinks:

segments.pli: ‘sace kho maṃ bhikkhū jānissanti—
segments.en: ‘Suppose the monks know that I’m a bad monk …

segments.pli: dussīlo pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakammanto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujātoti, samaggā maṃ santā nāsessanti;
segments.en: If they’re in harmony, they’ll expel me,

segments.pli: vaggā pana maṃ na nāsessantī’ti.
segments.en: but if they’re divided they won’t.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, ānanda, paṭhamaṃ atthavasaṃ sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṅghabhedena nandati.
segments.en: A bad monk sees this as the first reason to relish schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, pāpabhikkhu micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad monk has wrong view, he’s attached to an extremist view.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: He thinks:

segments.pli: ‘sace kho maṃ bhikkhū jānissanti—
segments.en: ‘Suppose the monks know that I have wrong view …

segments.pli: micchādiṭṭhiko antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgatoti, samaggā maṃ santā nāsessanti;
segments.en: If they’re in harmony they’ll expel me,

segments.pli: vaggā pana maṃ na nāsessantī’ti.
segments.en: but if they’re divided they won’t.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, ānanda, dutiyaṃ atthavasaṃ sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṅghabhedena nandati.
segments.en: A bad monk sees this as the second reason to relish schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, pāpabhikkhu micchāājīvo hoti, micchāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad monk has wrong livelihood and earns a living by wrong livelihood.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: He thinks:

segments.pli: ‘sace kho maṃ bhikkhū jānissanti—
segments.en: ‘Suppose the monks know that I have wrong livelihood …

segments.pli: micchāājīvo micchāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappetīti, samaggā maṃ santā nāsessanti;
segments.en: If they’re in harmony they’ll expel me,

segments.pli: vaggā pana maṃ na nāsessantī’ti.
segments.en: but if they’re divided they won’t.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, ānanda, tatiyaṃ atthavasaṃ sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṃghabhedena nandati.
segments.en: A bad monk sees this as the third reason to relish schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, pāpabhikkhu lābhakāmo hoti sakkārakāmo anavaññattikāmo.
segments.en: Furthermore, a bad monk desires material possessions, honor, and admiration.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: He thinks:

segments.pli: ‘sace kho maṃ bhikkhū jānissanti—
segments.en: ‘Suppose the monks know that I desire material possessions, honor, and admiration.

segments.pli: lābhakāmo sakkārakāmo anavaññattikāmoti, samaggā maṃ santā na sakkarissanti na garuṃ karissanti na mānessanti na pūjessanti;
segments.en: If they’re in harmony they won’t honor, respect, revere, or venerate me,

segments.pli: vaggā pana maṃ sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessantī’ti.
segments.en: but if they’re divided they will.’

segments.pli: Idaṃ, ānanda, catutthaṃ atthavasaṃ sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṅghabhedena nandati.
segments.en: A bad monk sees this as the fourth reason to relish schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Ime kho, ānanda, cattāro atthavase sampassamāno pāpabhikkhu saṅghabhedena nandatī”ti.
segments.en: A bad monk sees these four reasons to relish schism in the Saṅgha.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: A bad monk enjoys schism in the Saṅgha.
